strapiPost.title: Ontario and Northwest Arkansas Strengthen Trade Ties
strapiPost.content:
Ontario's Minister of Economic Development, Victor Fedeli, visited Bentonville earlier this week for conversations with Arkansas leadership regarding increasing trade between the regions. Canada is Arkansasâ€™s largest trade partner, with nearly $1b worth of rice and poultry being exported to Ontario each year.

Direct Route: On Sunday, Fedeli met with regional leaders at the Northwest Arkansas National Airport to discuss establishing a direct flight to Toronto, then toured several venues in Downtown Bentonville, including the Ledger.

Triple the Trade: Conversations continued Monday at the Momentary with government officials and business leaders, establishing deeper relationships and setting goals to increase bilateral trade between Ontario and Northwest Arkansas from $2b to $6b by 2027.

Find more details in Talk Business & Politics HERE.
